medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The proband began to experience muscle cramping and tetany at age 8 and was diagnosed with pseudoidiopathic hypoparathyroidism at age 20 based on severe hypocalcemia (6.9 mg/dL) with normal magnesium and hyperphosphatemia (6.5 mg/dL). Over several years, serum calcium ranged from 5.3 to 6.9 mg/dL. He was re-assessed at age 30 and diagnosed with idiopathic hypoparathyroidism with low serum levels of PTH when hypocalcemic. Additional family members also exhibited hypocalcemic symptoms within the first two decades of life.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic hypoparathyroidism and bilateral subcapsular cataracts at diagnosis.
medical_history.family_history: A multigenerational family history of hypoparathyroidism with 14 affected members across two families.
